Package it.polimi.ingsw.client.gui

Class Gui

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.server.view.ViewObservable
it.polimi.ingsw.client.View
it.polimi.ingsw.client.gui.Gui
All Implemented Interfaces:
OpponentDisconnectionObserver, SocketObserver, BuilderBuiltObserver, BuilderMovementObserver, BuilderPossibleBuildObserver, BuilderPossibleMoveObserver, BuildersPlacedObserver, ChosenStepObserver, ColorAssignmentObserver, EndGameObserver, ErrorsObserver, GodChoiceObserver, PlayerAddedObserver, PlayerLoseObserver, PlayerTurnObserver, StartPlayerSetObserver, StateObserver
public class Gui
extends View
Author:
veronica Graphical User Interface which extends the abstract class View, to share methods and attributes with Cli

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    Gui​(javafx.stage.Stage primaryStageParam)
    Constructor that creates the primaryStage, sets the home scene and creates the main scene opened after the connection The main stage is composed by a BorderPane as root with inside a VBox as playersRegion with players infos on the left, a VBox as dialogRegion (on the right) in which are shown the requests during the match, an AnchorPane in the bottom in which are printed messages on the left and buttons on the right to show godCards and to quit, the title on the top in a StackPane and finally in the center a tilePane which represents the gameBoard It also creates a starting homeScene

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    private void activatePlayBtn()
    Private method used to set the handler on a mouse clicked event, which is reset after each click, to avoid multiple connection requests simultaneously.
    private void afterDomeChoice()
    Shows the possible destinations after the choice of building a dome or not (if yes, shows just where a dome can be built), then it proceeds with the BUILD step
    void askBuilderColor​(java.util.Set<java.lang.String> chosenColors)
    Creates a ChoicePopup to make each player choose his color
    private void askForDome()
    This method sets the buildDome value to true or false after the current player clicks on yes or no buttons
    void askGodCard​(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.String> godDescriptions, java.util.Set<java.lang.String> chosenCards)
    Creates a GodCardsPopup for each player to make him choose his godCard
    void askNickAndDate()
    Creates a PlayersSetupPopup to make each player insert their nickname and birthday date, with two TextFields whose content is sent to the server after the submit button is pressed
    void askNumberOfPlayers()
    Creates a ChoicePopup allowing the first player to choose the number of players of the match, with a choiceBox to show which are the possibilities
    void build()
    If the builder has not been chosen yet, if the player can build a dome somewhere, asks for building a dome or not, otherwise shows the possible destinations and to select a builder.
    private void buildToDst()
    On turn builder chosen, shows the possible destinations to build and adds an eventHandler on them to notify the build destination choice.
    void chooseMatchGodCards​(int numOfPlayers, java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.String> godDescriptionsParam)
    Sends a GodCardsPopup to the Challenger with all the possible cards, sent through godDescriptionsParam
    void chooseNextStep​(java.util.Set<java.lang.String> possibleSteps)
    Creates a label and a choiceBox to ask the user to select how he wants to continue his turn or if he wants to end it.
    void chooseStartPlayer​(java.util.Set<java.lang.String> players)
    Creates a ChoicePopup to make the Challenger choose the first player of the match
    private void chooseTurnBuilder()
    This method makes the user choose the turn builder and than calls moveOnBuilderChosen or buildToDst to complete the first step of the turn.
    protected static boolean confirmQuit()
    Predefined alert popup to confirm the leaving of the match, returns true if the user clicks on YES button, false if it clicks on CANCEL and so the closure is canceled
    private int getBuilderIndexInStack​(Coordinates cellStackCoord)
    Returns the position(index) of the builder in the StackPane (cell)
    void move()
    Shows the possible destinations for a move for both builders if the builder hasn't been chosen and gives the possibility to choose the turn builder.
    private void moveOnBuilderChosen()
    On turn builder chosen, shows the possible destinations and adds an eventHandler on them in order to notify the chosen move destination after being clicked.
    void onBuilderBuild​(java.lang.String nickname, Coordinates src, Coordinates dst, boolean dome, boolean result)
    If the build is successful, resets the possible destinations for the player who did it and creates the new building for the other ones.
    void onBuilderMovement​(java.lang.String nickname, Coordinates src, Coordinates dst, boolean result)
    If the move is successful, resets the possible destinations for the player who did it, updates the currentTurnBuilderPos to the dest of the move, updates the occupied cells and does the effective move through GuiMap method moveBuilder
    void onBuildersPlacedUpdate​(java.lang.String nickname, Coordinates positionBuilder1, Coordinates positionBuilder2, boolean result)
    After a successful placement, the handler for MouseClicked event is reset, for the player who did the placement is showed a message of successful placement and for the others the gameMap is updated
    void onChosenStep​(java.lang.String nickname, java.lang.String step, boolean result)
    If result is true, shows a message of step choice to the other players, otherwise shows an error for the player who did the step choice
    void onColorAssigned​(java.lang.String nickname, java.lang.String color, boolean result)
    Closes the choiceSetupPopup of color choice for the player who has successfully chosen his color
    void onConnectionError​(java.lang.String message)
    Prints a message of connection error
    void onDisconnection()
    Notifies the player that they've been disconnected and creates a play again button, so that each user can choose to play again or to quit the game.
    void onEndGameUpdate​(java.lang.String winnerNickname)
    Prints endGame messages of loss and victory and a normal message to inform about who won
    void onGodCardAssigned​(java.lang.String nickname, java.lang.String card, boolean result)
    Closes godCardsPopup if result is true, otherwise prints an error message
    void onLossUpdate​(java.lang.String nickname)
    Super removes the player from the map of players - godCards.
    void onMatchGodCardsAssigned​(java.util.Set<java.lang.String> godCardsToUse, boolean result)
    For the challenger, if result is positive (result = true), closes the godCardsPopup, otherwise prints an error message.
    void onOpponentDisconnection​(java.lang.String nickname)
    Notifies the players that someone has disconnected
    void onPlayerAdded​(java.lang.String nickname, boolean result)
    Prints a message to notify the entry of a new player and closes his player setup popup.
    void onPlayerTurn​(java.lang.String nickname)
    Resets the turn builder if it's not null (it's not the first turn), glows the name of the current player in the nameTag and resets the old one.
    void onStartPlayerSet​(java.lang.String nickname, boolean result)
    Prints the message of starting player chosen.
    void onStateUpdate​(Model.State currState)
    When the match is in the state SETUP_BUILDERS, the playersRegion is featured with players nicknames and gods, when the match is in SETUP_PLAYERS, the user is advised to wait for players to enter and the bottom messages VBox is set.
    void onWrongInsertionUpdate​(java.lang.String error)
    Prints a generic message of error passed by server
    void onWrongNumberInsertion()
    Prints a message of wrong number insertion and asks again the num of players.
    void placeBuilders()
    For each cell in the tile (map), if the state is BUILDERPLACEMENT and the cell is not already occupied, clicking on it a new builder is added calling the method createBuilder in GuiMap.
    private void popupClosing​(javafx.stage.Stage popup, javafx.stage.WindowEvent windowEvent)
    This private method is used to set the handler of a windowEvent, so that, except during the connection phase, an alert will open on close request to warn the user that closing that window he'll leave the game
    private void printMessage​(java.lang.String message, boolean onPopup)
    Used to print a generic message in function of the currState value.
    private void printOnPrimaryScene​(java.lang.String message)
    Private method used to add a message on the primary scene (in bottomMessagesVBox)
    private void resetAll()
    Private method used to reset primaryScene and homeScene for a new match.
    void run()
    Main User Interface Function.
    private void setFadeTransition​(javafx.scene.control.Label label)  
    private void setPlayersRegion()
    This method is used to set the players region (left side of the root borderPane) with player names and nametags images and their chosen godCards
    (package private) void setPrimarySceneButtonBinding​(javafx.scene.control.Button button)
    Sets the correct binding for a button on the primary scene
    private javafx.scene.layout.StackPane setTitle​(javafx.scene.Scene s)
    This method creates the title StackPane
    void updatePossibleBuildDst​(java.util.Set<Coordinates> possibleDstBuilder1, java.util.Set<Coordinates> possibleDstBuilder2, java.util.Set<Coordinates> possibleDstBuilder1forDome, java.util.Set<Coordinates> possibleDstBuilder2forDome)
    Updates the possible set of coordinates of cells in which the player in the BUILD step can build a new floor
    void updatePossibleMoveDst​(java.util.Set<Coordinates> possibleDstBuilder1, java.util.Set<Coordinates> possibleDstBuilder2)
    Updates the possible set of coordinates of cells in which the player in the MOVE step can move his builders

  • Constructor Details

    • Gui

      public Gui​(javafx.stage.Stage primaryStageParam)
      Constructor that creates the primaryStage, sets the home scene and creates the main scene opened after the connection The main stage is composed by a BorderPane as root with inside a VBox as playersRegion with players infos on the left, a VBox as dialogRegion (on the right) in which are shown the requests during the match, an AnchorPane in the bottom in which are printed messages on the left and buttons on the right to show godCards and to quit, the title on the top in a StackPane and finally in the center a tilePane which represents the gameBoard It also creates a starting homeScene
      Parameters:
      primaryStageParam - principal stage of the match

  • Method Details

    • setFadeTransition

      private void setFadeTransition​(javafx.scene.control.Label label)

    • activatePlayBtn

      private void activatePlayBtn()
      Private method used to set the handler on a mouse clicked event, which is reset after each click, to avoid multiple connection requests simultaneously.

      private javafx.scene.layout.StackPane setTitle​(javafx.scene.Scene s)
      This method creates the title StackPane
      Parameters:

      Returns:
      the StackPane of the title (titlePane)

    • printMessage

      private void printMessage​(java.lang.String message, boolean onPopup)
      Used to print a generic message in function of the currState value. Prints on home if the state is CONNECTION, on a popup if there's a popup opened, or on the primary scene through the specific method
      Parameters:
      message - error or information messages

    • popupClosing

      private void popupClosing​(javafx.stage.Stage popup, javafx.stage.WindowEvent windowEvent)
      This private method is used to set the handler of a windowEvent, so that, except during the connection phase, an alert will open on close request to warn the user that closing that window he'll leave the game
      Parameters:
      popup - stage to close, on which the event happened
      windowEvent - event to handle

      Overrides:
      askNickAndDate in class View

      Overrides:
      chooseMatchGodCards in class View
      Parameters:
      numOfPlayers - number of the players of the match, and also of the godCards to choose

      Creates a GodCardsPopup for each player to make him choose his godCard
      Overrides:
      askGodCard in class View
      Parameters:
      godDescriptions - map of each card with its description
      chosenCards - already chosen cards

      Overrides:
      askBuilderColor in class View
      Parameters:
      chosenColors - already chosen colors, not to be showed as possibilities

    • placeBuilders

      public void placeBuilders()
      For each cell in the tile (map), if the state is BUILDERPLACEMENT and the cell is not already occupied, clicking on it a new builder is added calling the method createBuilder in GuiMap. This method updates also occupiedCells
      Overrides:
      placeBuilders in class View

    • chooseNextStep

      public void chooseNextStep​(java.util.Set<java.lang.String> possibleSteps)
      Creates a label and a choiceBox to ask the user to select how he wants to continue his turn or if he wants to end it.
      Overrides:
      chooseNextStep in class View
      Parameters:
      possibleSteps - set of the possible choices to continue the game

    • setPrimarySceneButtonBinding

      void setPrimarySceneButtonBinding​(javafx.scene.control.Button button)
      Sets the correct binding for a button on the primary scene
      Parameters:
      button - button to bind

    • move

      public void move()
      Shows the possible destinations for a move for both builders if the builder hasn't been chosen and gives the possibility to choose the turn builder. Otherwise, it allows to move with the chosen builder calling moveOnBuilderChosen()
      Specified by:
      move in class View

    • chooseTurnBuilder

      private void chooseTurnBuilder()
      This method makes the user choose the turn builder and than calls moveOnBuilderChosen or buildToDst to complete the first step of the turn. After the choice, both the clicked builder and the other one are reset (can't be selected anymore) and the current turn builder position is set, with the chosen builder number.

    • moveOnBuilderChosen

      private void moveOnBuilderChosen()
      On turn builder chosen, shows the possible destinations and adds an eventHandler on them in order to notify the chosen move destination after being clicked. It updates also the currentTrunBuilderPos.

    • buildToDst

      private void buildToDst()
      On turn builder chosen, shows the possible destinations to build and adds an eventHandler on them to notify the build destination choice.

    • askForDome

      private void askForDome()
      This method sets the buildDome value to true or false after the current player clicks on yes or no buttons

    • afterDomeChoice

      private void afterDomeChoice()
      Shows the possible destinations after the choice of building a dome or not (if yes, shows just where a dome can be built), then it proceeds with the BUILD step

    • build

      public void build()
      If the builder has not been chosen yet, if the player can build a dome somewhere, asks for building a dome or not, otherwise shows the possible destinations and to select a builder. If the builder has been chosen, if it can build a dome somewhere, asks for building a dome or not, otherwise calls "buildToDst" to show the possible destinations for that builder and make them clickable
      Specified by:
      build in class View

    • onBuilderBuild

      public void onBuilderBuild​(java.lang.String nickname, Coordinates src, Coordinates dst, boolean dome, boolean result)
      If the build is successful, resets the possible destinations for the player who did it and creates the new building for the other ones. Otherwise, prints a message of error.
      Specified by:
      onBuilderBuild in interface BuilderBuiltObserver
      Overrides:
      onBuilderBuild in class View
      Parameters:
      nickname - current player who's building
      src - builder position in coordinates
      dst - where the player has choose to build
      dome - true if the player wanted to build/has built a dome
      result - true if the build was successful

    • onBuilderMovement

      public void onBuilderMovement​(java.lang.String nickname, Coordinates src, Coordinates dst, boolean result)
      If the move is successful, resets the possible destinations for the player who did it, updates the currentTurnBuilderPos to the dest of the move, updates the occupied cells and does the effective move through GuiMap method moveBuilder
      Specified by:
      onBuilderMovement in interface BuilderMovementObserver
      Overrides:
      onBuilderMovement in class View
      Parameters:
      nickname - of the current player
      src - coordinates of the previous position of the builder
      dst - coordinates of the destination of the move step
      result - true if the movement is successful

    • updatePossibleBuildDst

      public void updatePossibleBuildDst​(java.util.Set<Coordinates> possibleDstBuilder1, java.util.Set<Coordinates> possibleDstBuilder2, java.util.Set<Coordinates> possibleDstBuilder1forDome, java.util.Set<Coordinates> possibleDstBuilder2forDome)
      Updates the possible set of coordinates of cells in which the player in the BUILD step can build a new floor
      Specified by:
      updatePossibleBuildDst in interface BuilderPossibleBuildObserver
      Overrides:
      updatePossibleBuildDst in class View
      Parameters:
      possibleDstBuilder1 - positions where builder 1 can build a normal building
      possibleDstBuilder2 - positions where builder 2 can build a normal building
      possibleDstBuilder1forDome - positions where builder 1 can build a dome
      possibleDstBuilder2forDome - positions where builder 2 can build a dome

    • updatePossibleMoveDst

      public void updatePossibleMoveDst​(java.util.Set<Coordinates> possibleDstBuilder1, java.util.Set<Coordinates> possibleDstBuilder2)
      Updates the possible set of coordinates of cells in which the player in the MOVE step can move his builders
      Specified by:
      updatePossibleMoveDst in interface BuilderPossibleMoveObserver
      Overrides:
      updatePossibleMoveDst in class View
      Parameters:
      possibleDstBuilder1 - positions at which builder 1 can move
      possibleDstBuilder2 - positions at which builder 2 can move

    • onBuildersPlacedUpdate

      public void onBuildersPlacedUpdate​(java.lang.String nickname, Coordinates positionBuilder1, Coordinates positionBuilder2, boolean result)
      After a successful placement, the handler for MouseClicked event is reset, for the player who did the placement is showed a message of successful placement and for the others the gameMap is updated
      Specified by:
      onBuildersPlacedUpdate in interface BuildersPlacedObserver
      Overrides:
      onBuildersPlacedUpdate in class View
      Parameters:
      nickname - of the player who just placed his builders
      positionBuilder1 - coordinates of the first builder
      positionBuilder2 - coordinates of the second one
      result - true if the placement of the builders is correct

    • onChosenStep

      public void onChosenStep​(java.lang.String nickname, java.lang.String step, boolean result)
      If result is true, shows a message of step choice to the other players, otherwise shows an error for the player who did the step choice
      Specified by:
      onChosenStep in interface ChosenStepObserver
      Overrides:
      onChosenStep in class View
      Parameters:
      nickname - the player who chose the step from a list of possible ones
      step - chosen step
      result - true if the server accepted the request

    • resetAll

      private void resetAll()

    • onPlayerAdded

      public void onPlayerAdded​(java.lang.String nickname, boolean result)
      Prints a message to notify the entry of a new player and closes his player setup popup. If the result is false prints a message of error and resets nick and date
      Specified by:

      Overrides:
      onPlayerAdded in class View
      Parameters:
      nickname - nickname of the player
      result - true if the server accepted the registration

    • onLossUpdate

      public void onLossUpdate​(java.lang.String nickname)
      Super removes the player from the map of players - godCards. This method sends a normal message to all the players about who has lost, and an endgame one to the player who lost It also removes the loser builders from the map through the method remove builders of gameMap
      Specified by:
      onLossUpdate in interface PlayerLoseObserver
      Overrides:
      onLossUpdate in class View
      Parameters:
      nickname - player who lost

    • onPlayerTurn

      public void onPlayerTurn​(java.lang.String nickname)

      Specified by:

      Overrides:

    • onStateUpdate

      public void onStateUpdate​(Model.State currState)
      When the match is in the state SETUP_BUILDERS, the playersRegion is featured with players nicknames and gods, when the match is in SETUP_PLAYERS, the user is advised to wait for players to enter and the bottom messages VBox is set. Also the scene is changed from homeScene to primaryScene.
      Specified by:
      onStateUpdate in interface StateObserver
      Specified by:
      onStateUpdate in class View
      Parameters:
      currState - currState of the model

    • confirmQuit

      protected static boolean confirmQuit()
      Predefined alert popup to confirm the leaving of the match, returns true if the user clicks on YES button, false if it clicks on CANCEL and so the closure is canceled

    • onConnectionError

      public void onConnectionError​(java.lang.String message)
      Prints a message of connection error
      Parameters:
      message - error message received from server

    • onDisconnection

      public void onDisconnection()
      Notifies the player that they've been disconnected and creates a play again button, so that each user can choose to play again or to quit the game.
      Specified by:
      onDisconnection in interface SocketObserver
      Overrides:
      onDisconnection in class View

    • setPlayersRegion

      private void setPlayersRegion()
      This method is used to set the players region (left side of the root borderPane) with player names and nametags images and their chosen godCards

    • onOpponentDisconnection

      public void onOpponentDisconnection​(java.lang.String nickname)
      Notifies the players that someone has disconnected
      Parameters:
      nickname - of the player who disconnected, if it has already a nickname, null otherwise.
